revised_title: The Effect of Sodic and Potassic Sulphates on the Formation of Ammonia
tldr: This study investigates the influence of sodic and potassic sulphates on the rate of ammonia formation when nascent hydrogen acts on potassic nitrate. The results show that both sodic and potassic sulphates have a significant impact on the reaction, with the reaction being accelerated as more sulphate is added. Furthermore, equal weights of sodic and potassic sulphates have nearly the same working effect, suggesting that their chemical equivalents are equal.
